results.title: Celebrations: christmas
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “For the juniors”.
Narrated by Eileen Darley, this program aimed at young children looks at the celebrations surrounding Christmas. It follows the signs and symbols that signify Christmas is near, such as shopping, store and street decorations, advent calendars, parades, sending cards, making your own gifts, decorating trees, the importance of being with people you love, and being charitable to those in need. The program also looks at the origins of Christmas trees and cards, and the story of the first Christmas. Delicious traditional Christmas fare from Italy and Germany are also shown. Suitable for children 4-8.

results.title: Mr Gruber's mystery tour
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from chapter 4 from the book “Paddington marches on” by Michael Bond. Mr Gruber takes Paddington on a visit to the Wax Museum where Paddington is astonished and amazed at what he sees. Paddington has never visited the Wax Musem before. Narrated by Michael Hordern.

results.title: An Unexpected party
results.creator_credit: Ivor Wood, Michael Bond and FilmFair Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”
When word arrives that Paddington’s Aunt Lucy is celebrating her one-hundredth birthday, the Browns offer to send Paddington home to Lima to visit for the occasion. The Browns are afraid he will leave forever, but he assures them that he will return. Adapted from Chapter 7 from the book Paddington Marches On by Michael Bond. Narrated by Michael Hordern.

results.title: A Spot of decoration
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from the book ‘More about Paddington’. Paddington decides to decorate the attic at number Thirty-Two Windsor Gardens. Despite the best intentions, everything he does turns into disaster. Narrated by Michael Hordern. Suitable for lower and middle primary level.

results.title: Paddington goes underground
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Mrs Brown and Judy take Paddington on a trip to the London Underground where he experiences problems with the escalators and station staff.

results.title: Paddington and the cold snap
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from Chapter 1 from the book “Paddington Marches On” by Michael Bond. Paddington attempts to fix Mr Curry’s frozen water pipes but damages the bathroom so severely that the insurance company pays to have the entire room redecorated. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Paddington and the Christmas shopping; Christmas
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington and the Christmas Shopping is adapted from Chapter 6 of the book “More about Paddington” by Michael Bond. Paddington is on his way into the distinguished shop of Crunbold and Ferns but experiences trouble with the revolving doors. “Christmas” is adapted from Chapter 7 and for his first Christmas with the Brown family he receives a chemistry set, a scrapbook and a xylophone.

results.title: Please look after this bear
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Presents an animated adaptation of Chapter I of the book “A Bear called Paddington” by Michael Bond. Narrated by Michael Hordern. Animation by Ivor Wood. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Paddington and the 'old master'
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington and the Old Master is adapted from Chapters 4, 5 and 8 of “A Bear called Paddington” by Michael Bond. Paddington learns from Mr Gruber, an antique dealer, that old masterpieces are sometimes covered by newer paintings and that the “old master” can be restored. Paddington decides to apply this technique to one of Mr Brown’s paintings with disastrous results. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
results.description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
